definition: to lift/to hold up/to cite/to enumerate/to act/to raise/to choose/to elect/act/move/deed
to rise/to flourish/to become popular/to start/to encourage/to get up/(often used in the negative) to permit or allow (dialect)/maybe (dialect)
feeling or desire to do sth/interest in sth/excitement
to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
a move/an action/in one move/at a stroke/in one go
to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold

sentences.english: Every page is crowded with facts.
What are the different types of determiners?Please give two example of your own for each type.
sentences.chinese: 请就每个类别各举两个你自己的例子。

sentences.english: The non-symmetrical AHP method is demonstrated with good feasibility.
sentences.chinese: 最后，举一个实例来验证这一方法的可行性。

sentences.english: That means avoiding the use of sarcasm or putdowns, for example.
sentences.chinese: 举个例，那就是说，避免使用讽刺或。

sentences.english: Finally, two examples are given to illustrate the application of the results.
sentences.chinese: 文未，举两例说明结果的应用。

sentences.english: And last year, he criticised women who pray at the Western Wall as "stupid".
sentences.chinese: 去年他又指责妇女在哭墙祈祷是愚蠢之举。

sentences.english: The trouble is that Bernanke’s stimulus spending was a blunderbuss.
sentences.chinese: 麻烦在于伯南克推行消费刺激政策实乃草率之举。

sentences.english: And we must make certain that they are no longer perceived as risk-free.
sentences.chinese: 而且我们必须确保不让它再被视为是无风险之举。

sentences.english: I would like, I'll give you a couple of illustrations of this.
Stretch your arms over your head.
One member after another raised his hand.
sentences.chinese: 一个接一个的成员都举了手。

sentences.english: Communication may be the key to a successful transition to a smoke-free hospital, they concluded.
sentences.chinese: 沟通也许是成功过渡到禁烟医院的关键之举。

sentences.english: They raised their hands up straight, so that the teacher could see them.
sentences.chinese: 他们把手举起来伸直，好让老师看见。

sentences.english: Post allowance system (PAS) is an innovation method of distribution system in college and university.
sentences.chinese: 高校岗位津贴制度是高校分配制度的创新之举。

sentences.english: Under excitement, the dog may carry his tail somewhat higher, but not cocked up.
sentences.chinese: 在兴奋时，尾巴可能举的高一些，但决不能向上竖起。

sentences.english: Me: Yes , my bachelor degree is law.
sentences.chinese: 同时给他举起来我的学位证和毕业证。

definition: to heave/to lift/to raise up/to uphold
to raise a hand/to put up one's hand (as signal)
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help
to hold/to grasp/to clench (one's fist)/to master/classifier: a handful
to erect (a tent etc)/to prick up (one's ears)/to raise (one's eyebrows)/to stick up (one's thumb)/to turn up (one's collar)/(of a bird) to puff up (one's feathers)
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
to wave/to brandish/to command/to conduct/to scatter/to disperse
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
to point towards/aimed at/facing/the direction indicated
